Description: Red Sea or Indian Ocean Tridacna species clam shell. Unworked, but probably used as a dish.
Curator's comments: Found in box of unregistered shells with other shells that had handwritten slips written by Petrie identifying the shell species and naming Naukratis as the provenance. This shell was found with a note by Petrie: 'Tridacna sp Red Sea Nebireh (Naucratis) 1885 '. Tridacninae come from the Indo-Pacific region. The Red Sea would appear to be the closest source (WoRMS). Such shells were common at the Red Sea port of Myos Hormos (Hamilton-Dyer 2011, 270).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (WA.11)
